New Records: Morocco defeated Lesotho 1-0 in their AFCON 2025 qualifier match on September 9, 2024, with Brahim Diaz scoring the winning goal in stoppage time.
Ayoub El Kaabi had a missed opportunity in the first half, while Abdessamad Ezzalzouli missed an open goal in the second half.
Morocco's coach Walid Regragui used the match as a warm-up before more challenging AFCON 2025 fixtures.
Morocco's starting lineup saw a comprehensive reshuffle following their 4-0 win against Gabon in their previous match.
Pre-Game Insights: Morocco's coach Walid Regragui emphasized the importance of the match as a warm-up for tougher challenges ahead in AFCON 2025.
Lesotho put up a strong fight but couldn't capitalize on their chances, contributing to Morocco's narrow victory.
